text:
We’re seeing pretty poor pagespeed scores recently for sites that performed in 70-93/100 range on mobile previously. Many of the sites haven’t had any updates to external scripts or media files etc.

We have an untouched site that scores 41/100 now vs 93/100 a month or so ago.

Has anyone seem similar changes in their scores or can confirm something is going on?
the call for hsforms v2.js takes up a lot of load time (23%) among other things HS

Seems like the *Trust Center* is having some problems - which I’m a bit loath to share with potential customers.

Is it being fixed? Many 404s, 503s… Christmas tree of lights right now!
<@U03MU3H35R6> This should be reported to HubSpot support. I think only they can help
<@U01BJF5QAKA> Sure, just wanted to see if others had the issue as well, as it might be a connectivity issue on my end

<@U03MU3H35R6> If you are using Lighthouse then that could connectivity issue on your side as it uses your connection to do the scoring but if you are checking it on Google Page Insights then it’s a problem from HubSpot end

Might also be an issue with the pagespeed service itself. I’ve had strange issues with it before.

But, I’ll make some colleagues check the sites from the office and test again tomorrow. If the low scores remain, I’ll reach out to support. Thanks!
Sounds good

I just noticed the new beta forms module now embeds the form code directly into the website instead of using an iframe—this is amazing news! :tada: Can we get more clarity on how the form’s styling integrates (or should integrate) with themes?

Hi Team,

Is there a way to have a user sign in to his HubSpot account, from an external website? Maybe a link from the external website to a HubSpot login page, that redirects the user back to an external page with some parameters in the url like the users contactId?

Thanks.
just saw this forms v2 flag in lighthouse today and yeah it is definitely causing a drop in scores for me too
especially on mobile.....

Hi everyone! :wave: I’m facing an issue with integrating a form designed in Webflow with HubSpot, and I’m hoping someone here can share a suggestion.
In Webflow, we designed the form as shown in this image (see the section *"Would you like to receive specific information?"*). Each option, like "Shift Management" or "Time Tracking," is configured as checkboxes in Webflow. This form is linked to a HubSpot form, where the corresponding field is created as *"Single-line text."*
The problem is that when someone fills out the form and selects any of these checkboxes, HubSpot only receives "On" instead of the specific value of the selected option (e.g., "Shift Management," "Time Tracking," etc.). This prevents us from knowing the exact information chosen by the user.
We tried configuring this field as a checkbox group directly in HubSpot, but we struggled to customize the design to meet our needs: splitting the options into two columns and rounding the corners.
Does anyone have any ideas on how to solve this? We need a way to receive the detailed information about the selected options in HubSpot from the Webflow form.
Thanks in advance for any suggestions or solutions you can share! :raised_hands:

Hello,
Is there a way to create a subscription in HubSpot using HS API or when a new subscription is created in Stripe it creates a new subscription in HS?

:HubSpotheart:*Help your fellow HubSpot Developers!*:HubSpotheart:

This Slack lives and breathes by its community. If you're posting a question, take a moment and click around a few channels to see if there are any questions you can help answer. Instant karma!

I’m in the same boat as well.
Is there a changelog or any documentation about the recent changes to this file? It would be awesome to get some updates on this. I checked the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog|developers' changelog>, but there’s nothing mentioned about it lately

Hi <@U082TMYPJBW> how are you submitting the form, are you using the API? Take a look at <https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/reference/api/marketing/forms/v3-legacy> which allows you to submit the form data, either to a HubSpot form or use non-HubSpot forms.
